definition: at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
(negative prefix)/not/no
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
dusk/evening/Taiwan pr. [xi4]

sentences.english: They eke out a precarious existence foraging in rubbish dumps.
sentences.chinese: 他们靠在垃圾场捡垃圾维持着朝不保夕的生活。

sentences.english: The situation is developing in such a way as to make the position of the democracies precarious.
sentences.chinese: 局势在发展，致使民主国家的地位朝不保夕。

sentences.english: The family lived a precarious existence.
sentences.chinese: 家人过着朝不保夕的生活。

sentences.english: They lived precariously on the income from a few small investments.
sentences.chinese: 他们依靠些微投资中的收入，过着朝不保夕的生活。

sentences.english: He earned a precarious living as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个艺术家，他过的是朝不保夕的生活。

sentences.english: The Atomic Age has caught us in a web of fear. Our lives seem so impermanent and uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 核武时代使我们陷入恐慌，我们的生命几近朝不保夕。

sentences.english: We always lived from hand to mouth in those days.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，我们老是过着朝不保夕的生活。

definition: lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to rely on others for the air one breathes (idiom); to depend on sb's whim for one's living
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
soldiers munity and troops rebel (idiom); turmoil and chaos of war
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
to struggle on whilst at death's door (idiom)
to be unable to carry on even for a single day/to be in a desperate situation
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
to lodge under another person's roof (idiom); to live relying on sb else's charity
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
impossible to make a living
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
short of food and clothing/destitute
